revisions.*: {{no footnotes|date=February 2013}} {{Infobox scientist | name = Grace Wahba | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1934|08|03|mf=y}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[United States|American]] | fields = [[Mathematics]] | workplaces = [[University of Wisconsin–Madison]] | alma_mater = [[Stanford University]] | doctoral_advisor = [[Emanuel Parzen]] | doctoral_students = | known_for = | awards = }} '''Grace Wahba''' (born August 3, 1934) is the I. J. Schoenberg Professor of [[Statistics]] at the [[University of Wisconsin–Madison]]. She is a pioneer in methods for [[smoothing]] noisy data. Best known for the development of generalized [[cross-validation (statistics)|cross-validation]] and "[[Wahba's problem]]", she has developed methods with applications in [[demographic]] studies, [[machine learning]], [[DNA microarrays]], [[risk modeling]], [[medical imaging]], and [[Numerical weather prediction|climate prediction]]. She was educated at [[Cornell]] (B.A. 1956), [[University of Maryland, College Park]] (M.A. 1962) and [[Stanford]] (Ph.D. 1966), and worked in industry for several years before receiving her doctorate in 1966 and settling in [[Madison, Wisconsin|Madison]] in 1967. She is the author of ''Spline Models for Observational Data''. She was elected to the [[United States National Academy of Sciences]] in 2000 and received an honorary degree of [[Doctor of Science]] from the University of Chicago in 2007. == External links == *{{MathGenealogy |id=32951 }} * [http://www.stat.wisc.edu/~wahba/ Grace Wahba's University of Wisconsin website Home page] * [http://www.ec-securehost.com/SIAM/CB59.html Spline Models for Observational Data] book {{Authority control}} {{Persondata | NAME = Wahba, Grace | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American statistician | DATE OF BIRTH = August 3, 1934 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wahba, Grace}} [[Category:1934 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American statisticians]] [[Category:Fellows of the American Statistical Association]] [[Category:Members of the United States National Academy of Sciences]] [[Category:ISI highly cited researchers]] [[Category:20th-century mathematicians]] [[Category:21st-century mathematicians]] [[Category:Fellows of the Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics]] [[Category:University of Wisconsin–Madison faculty]] [[Category:Cornell University alumni]] [[Category:University of Maryland, College Park alumni]] [[Category:Stanford University alumni]] [[Category:Bayesian statisticians]] [[Category:Women mathematicians]]
